alert.note: Alert for Delta (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 25 at 1:37PM MDT until May 26 at 3:30PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: .Warm temperatures will continue to melt snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Hydrologic flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...A portion of the North Fork Gunnison through Delta County. * WHEN...Until 600 PM MDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream levels are elevated, and fast flow will continue to carve and erode curved banks along the channel. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 133 PM MDT, emergency management reported flooding in the advisory area, mainly in the form of significant erosion of banks along the river. - This includes the following streams and drainages... North Fork Gunnison River - Some locations that will experience flooding include... remote areas near Hotchkiss and Paonia. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
